Leaves: Oval to spatula-like shape, 4-7 cm long. Fleshy and with varying lobes.
Flowers: White or pale pinkish-purple, with 4 petals, 4-8 mm across.
FruitSeeds: Two fused sections, upper is cone shaped, lower is cylindrical and similar width. Breaks open between two sections.
DistinguishingFeatures: American searocket (*Cakile edentula*) has a much narrower lower section of the fruit.
